Sentencas: Although hybrid solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) microturbine systems generate power more efficiently than stand-alone SOFC systems, hybrid systems remain in the demonstration phase.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: This study compares a hybrid system's exergetic and economic performance with that of a stand-alone system.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: Both systems meet a university building's kW-scale power demand.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: The hybrid system operates at 66% exergetic efficiency, and the stand-alone system operates at 59% exergetic efficiency.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: Increasing the fuel cell's operating voltage increases the systems' exergetic efficiencies, and varying the fuel cell's temperature, pressure, and fuel utilization influences the systems' exergetic performances, though to a lesser extent.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: This study calculates the systems' life cycle costs.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: We find that the systems' life cycle costs depend significantly on the systems' operation.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: During baseline operation, the hybrid system costs less than the stand-alone system.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: After optimizing the systems during cogeneration operation, the hybrid system costs slightly more than the stand-alone system.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: Overall, our findings support hybrid systems' continued research and development; it is recommended that future work simulate hybrid and stand-alone systems under a range of thermal-to-electric ratios to reflect different building types and operation.
Titulo: Exergy and economic comparison between kW-scale hybrid and stand-alone solid oxide fuel cell systems
